channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Unknown. Package was left at hazmat cage with no information provided. Package was placed into clear plastic hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote. DescribePack: Upon further inspection it was determined that the package was dropped and the bucket inside cracked along the bottom, causing the contents to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Unknown. Package was left at hazmat cage with no information provided. Package was placed into clear plastic hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote.

  • Description: EMPLOYEE WAS INSIDE THE TRAILER UNLOADING, WHEN HE CAME ACROSS THE PACKAGE SEATING IN THE FLOOR AND IMMEDIATELY NOTIFY HIS SUPERVISOR. NOTIFIED OUR FACILITY HAZMAT RESPONDER TO RESPOND TO THE HAZARDS PACKAGE. HE THEN FOLLOWED PROTOCOL AND CARRIED THE PACKAGE TO OUR DMP AREA FOR PROCESS.

item.title: Report X-2024030768

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found upside down contained in a Hazmat bag in QA damage area, then placed in a tote and moved to Hazmat area. DescribePack: Upon inspection, one cap was loose causing spillage. Cap on another bottle was tight but this bottle exhibited a slower drip when turned sideways. All 4 were still mostly full. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in tote lined with an additional Hazmat bag when moved to Hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024030767
item.description:
Report X-2024030767

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking in QA damage area. Absorbent was placed on spilled liquid. Package was moved to Hazmat area. DescribePack: Upon inspection, no active leakage was observed but one bottle felt slightly less full than the other. Both bottles were soiled by spilled liquid. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent powder was placed on spill. Package was placed in a tote lined with a Hazmat bag.

item.title: Report X-2024030858
item.description:
Report X-2024030858

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-26T15:10:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I was called on the radio that a corrosive package was at the end of the belt leaking. I put neutralizer on it, put on gloves, and put a liner in a drum and loaded it bringing it to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: two of the three bottles were leaking at the cap. You can compare to the other non leaker and see the amount that is gone. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Put neutralizer on the spilled portion and put all three jugs along with the box in a lined hazmat drum.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found to be leaking on load side 1 by door 106. QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were placed down to prevent injury. DescribePack: The package was dropped onto its base hard enough to crack the bottle, causing it to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were placed down to prevent injury.

DescribePack: cracked around the base of the plastic drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in a plastic lined hazmat drum to contain and leak/ spill.

item.title: Report E-2024030447
item.description:
Report E-2024030447

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 15, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon pail of UN3149 was punctured by a nail in transit and released approximately one (1) teaspoon of product to a cardboard box. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. All impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket for disposal purposes. The damaged one-gallon jug was collected and containerized into one (1) additional 5-gallon bucket for disposal purposes. The buckets were properly labeled and possession of the material was taken by RLC to be disposed of through their bulk waste stream.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was removed from the sortation. Package was unloaded from the trailer, unload noticed that the top of the box was wet. The parcel was placed in a tote then moved to the hazmat storage cage for inspection. DescribePack: loose cap, inoperable seal. the seal failed to operate as intended. even when the cap is tightened, a leak occurs. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: cap tightened, left in upright position.

The package was then brought to the damaged hazmat cage for processing. DescribePack: Loose caps led to leakage resulting in the box beginning to corrode and fall apart. Mngers Kat and Melissa removed all ics safely with PPE mask, gloved and protective glasses. Placed leaking haz mat into red lined tote and damages out the packages contaminated, DescribePack: Improper loading, Heavy packages were stacked on hazmat DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: load packages properly

item.title: Report E-2024030455
item.description:
Report E-2024030455

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: ABILENE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LAB experienced a UN1789 Blue Whale Muriatic Acid pH Reducer release from a box containing (2) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 4’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. Two damaged 1-gallon poly jugs were placed into a 5-gallon poly pail. Twelve impacted but not damaged jugs were placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Sodium bicarb was then deployed and utilized to neutralize the impacted areas. All impacted neutralized absorbents and cardboard were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024030392
item.description:
Report E-2024030392

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 13, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN2582 had a loose cap in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and sodium bicarbonate to remediate the UN2582-impacted tote. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket and staged on site for transport and disposal.

Upon inspection the box was and one of the bottles was dented and leaking from a loose cap. DescribePack: There was no seal on the closure just a cap and the cap was loose. This package a flammable liquid and did not have directional arrows. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was turned right side up.

item.title: Report X-2024030694
item.description:

item.title: Report X-2024030915
item.description:
Report X-2024030915

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: SPRING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came off the trailer with a small leak. bottom corner pf package dissolved. package was moved into a hazmat tote then moved to the hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: caps were leaking. bottles were not packed in alignment with the orientation arrows. bottles were packed in individual bags then placed horizontally on top of one another. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: bottle were placed upright in the tote to reduce the leak.

DescribePack: Loose cap/insufficient pack was the cause of the leak DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed upright with all of the bottles ensured they are not leaking anymore and taken back to the warehouse/placed in the hazmat cage

item.title: Report X-2024030877
item.description:
Report X-2024030877

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: EDINBURG
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from trailer 828118 that was sent from 774-HOUS-A at 0653. At approximately 0730 package was unloaded from a tugger cart and placed on portable belt at front of belt 1. Belt 1 manager noticed that the item appeared to have some of its contents spill out from its base and called QA to the belt to inspect the package. Upon inspection it was found that the inner item had a damaged base that allowed its contents to spill out. Item was placed in a yellow salvage drum and secured at QA1 to be processed post sort. DescribePack: inner item (plastic pale) cracked at the seam of its base, approximately 7 inches around. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as the item was confirmed to be damaged it was removed from the belt and placed in a salvage drum then secured at QA1 to minimize the potential for items or personnel being harmed by its contents.

  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5-gallons of MultiPUR - 2K Polyurethane Satin was released inside trailer #563-3694 due to a 5-gallon plastic pail being crushed by heavier freight while in transit. The spill was cleaned up in-house on February 20, 2024. ERTS advised the caller to call in for spill directives prior to completing the cleanup.

item.description:
Report E-2024030425

  • City: FORT WORTH

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 cups of Klean Strip Prep All were released from (2) cardboard boxes containing (4) 1-gallon metal cans per box due to improper loading by the previous shift. The release impacted the dock floor and the cardboard packaging. Oil Dri was used to absorb the released material. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are ok to have placed this in that waste container.

  • Description: At approximatly 1551 crew reported that the car was leaking from the manway when moved (Slosher) the car was immediately isolated and shipper was contacted. Shipper approved the use of PTRA contract Haz-Mat team to repair and remediate. Cause reported was loose manway bolts and no gasket., car was repaired, cleaned and released by Haz-Mat Special Services at 11 :21 AM on 01/06/24.

item.title: Report I-2024020057
item.description:
Report I-2024020057

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-18
  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PVS Transportation driver was unloading the product into the customer's tank while a customer's employee was monitoring the gauge on the tank {because the gauge was not visible from the truck). The customer's employee did not notify our driver to stop the flow of product until the tank started overflowing. The tank was overflowing into containment for approximately 8 seconds. The driver and operator at the facility cleaned up the spill by using spill pads to soak up and vinegar to neutralize the caustic soda. The gauge on the tank was stuck on 3/4 full.
